summary.para: Controls option flags for a new ID2D1ImageSource when it is created.

remarks.para: D2D1_IMAGE_SOURCE_CREATION_OPTIONS_RELEASE_SOURCE causes the image source to not retain a reference to the source object used to create it. It can decrease the quality and efficiency of printing.

summary.para: Indicates the image source should release its reference to the WIC bitmap source after it has initialized. By default, the image source retains a reference to the WIC bitmap source for the lifetime of the object to enable quality and speed optimizations for printing. This option disables that optimization.
Indicates the image source should only populate subregions of the image cache on-demand. You can control this behavior using the

and methods. This options provides the ability to improve memory usage by only keeping needed portions of the image in memory. This option requires that the image source has a reference to the WIC bitmap source, and is incompatible with D2D1_IMAGE_SOURCE_LOADING_OPTIONS_RELEASE_SOURCE.
